definition: to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)

sentences.english: If time is not pressing, sieges or neutralization will be likely options of choice.
sentences.chinese: 假按时分没有平静，也能够或许选择围攻或水力压抑。

sentences.english: Airlift tipped the balance of the sieges .
sentences.chinese: 空运扭转了围攻战的战局。

sentences.english: The great castles have multiple walls that have to be sieged or assualted seperatly.
sentences.chinese: 大城堡有多重城墙，必须要被围攻或者特别的渗透。

sentences.english: 1942- the World War Two siege of Bataan began.
sentences.chinese: 1942年的今天，第二次世界大战，开始围攻巴丹。

sentences.english: After the besiege of Beijing, Li Zicheng became dilapidated.
sentences.chinese: 后围攻北京，李自成变得破旧。

sentences.english: The beleaguered Jedi Knights fought valiantly to repulse the Mandalorian marauders.
sentences.chinese: 被围攻的绝地武士英勇战斗，击退了曼达洛强盗。

sentences.english: King Goodness told him the story of his escape from the band of jackals.
sentences.chinese: 大仁慈王告诉他自己是如何逃脱胡狼的围攻。

sentences.english: He captained the siege of Berlin.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥了围攻柏林的战役。

sentences.english: For some reason, their armor was identical to that of the 442nd Siege Battalion.
sentences.chinese: 因为某些因为，他们的装甲与442围攻营雷同。

sentences.english: During the Alliance push to defeat the Horde, Blackrock was besieged by human forces.
sentences.chinese: 当联盟大反攻时黑石塔受到人类的围攻。

sentences.english: TO CALL her embattled would be to exaggerate.
sentences.chinese: 说默克尔受到指责围攻，那也说得太夸张了。

sentences.english: When forty winters shall besiege thy brow.
sentences.chinese: 四十个冬天将围攻你的额角。

sentences.english: They successfully resisted the onslaught of the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 战场上，他们再一次成功遏阻了敌军的围攻。

sentences.english: It was the second dust-up to surround an Obama aide in two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这是两周来第二次对奥巴马助手的围攻。

sentences.english: Chiang-Nan seven strangely lay siege to, fly the poison pinprick of a day bat in my double eye.
sentences.chinese: 江南七怪的围攻，飞天蝙蝠的毒针刺中了我的双眼。

sentences.english: It would be the longest siege of a capital city in the history of modern warfare.
sentences.chinese: 这是现代战争史上对一座首都持续时间最长的围攻。

definition: to encircle and annihilate/refers to repeated campaigns of the Guomindang against the communists from 1930 onwards
to mount a sneak attack/to raid
attack from two sides/pincer movement/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
pincer attack/attack from two or more sides/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
